instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2936 quarter fan spin
threads.message:
checked all spi termination reistors and traces all is good even reprogrammed bios with no luck.

board had prior water damage it did at one point keep fan spinning but got no cpu checked the cpu ton resistors for u7400 even replaced u7400 still no luck and board is back to quarter fan spinning.

maybe its bad cpu?

checked the isl side resistors look fine not too sure where to look now.

threads.title: 820-2936 quarter fan spin
threads.message:
A shorted rail can also do this issue.
Did you check all rails, the one that are cycling with the fan goiing on aan off aad the one that are steady.

threads.title: 820-2936 quarter fan spin
threads.message:
Do you get pulses on all big coils, even VCORE?
SYSCLK_CLK25M_SB correct oscillation?
R7402 is OK?
ALL_SYS_PWRGD is pulsing?

threads.title: 820-2936 quarter fan spin
threads.message:
All coild except the vcore ones pulse. L7520, L7510, L7550 dont pulse. R7402 is fine ALL_SYS_PWRGD pulses

Cant check with an o-scope but i get a straight 0v no pulsing on SYSCLK_CLK25M_SB

threads.title: 820-2936 quarter fan spin
threads.message:
PCH requires SYSCLK_CLK25M_SB.
Check around U2800 and Y2805.
Change U2800 if no way to properly check 25MHz.
You can get cheap analog o-scope from Internet adds; you will need it to confirm oscillation many times.

threads.title: 820-2936 quarter fan spin
threads.message: I changed both those and still same issue ill try n change it one more time

threads.title: 820-2936 quarter fan spin
threads.message: Check traces between Y2805 and U2800...

threads.title: 820-2936 quarter fan spin
threads.message: Traces are good even replaced again and nothing

threads.title: 820-2936 quarter fan spin
threads.message: Post DC voltage on U2800 and Y2805.

threads.title: 820-2936 quarter fan spin
threads.message:
Y2805

pin 1 - pulses up to 0.014v
pin 3 - fluctuates from 0.328v to 0.700v

u2800

pin 1 - 3.3v
pin 2 - 3.3v
pin 3 - pulses up to 0.023v
pin 4 - fluctuates 0.647v to 0.743v
pin 5 - pulses 1v
pin 6 - 1v
pin 8 -0.065v and drops to 0.055v
pin 9 - 0v
pin 11 - pulses 1.7v
pin 12 - 0.396v
pin 13 - 3.4v
pin 14 - pulses 2.4v
pin 15 - pulses 0.895v

threads.title: 820-2936 quarter fan spin
threads.message:
Change Y2805 and associated caps and resistors.
I have no idea what value should show pin 9 in DC scale; supposedly cannot stay at 0V.
I recommend you to get an o-scope, or frequency meter.

threads.title: 820-2936 quarter fan spin
threads.message: Before measuring i had replaced y2805 and associated caps i guess maybe 3rd times the charm?

threads.title: 820-2936 quarter fan spin
threads.message: Changed some caps still same issue im just gonna move on.

threads.title: 820-2936 quarter fan spin
threads.message:
You need to confirm 25MHz for PCH.
If missing, that is good reason the board doesn't work...
